p: Therefore previous studies have shown that saponin-rich plants exhibit strong molluscicidal activity against terrestrial gastropods [ 13] and are safe (as saponin residues) in food and agronomic products [ 14]. Saponins are the natural glucosides found in plants where they occur as secondary metabolites [ 15]. Due to their amphiphilic nature, saponins can enter the cell membrane and cause increased cell permeability, resulting in disordered circulation of water and ions and disruption of membranes [ 16]. In vitro studies show that saponins have strong anti-cholesterol and anti-carcinogenic properties [ 15, 17]. The most recent data showed that saponin products help stimulate the immune response to co-administered antigens and have become increasingly important in the development of prophylactic and therapeutic vaccines [ 18].
